description.narrative: - The Project will lead to the creation of 150 direct and 120 sub-contracted jobs upon Project implementation. It will also create 10-15 managerial jobs & ~500 construction jobs during its peak construction. - The Project would produce Portland slag cement, which due to its low clinker-cement ratio would result in savings of 84,000 tons of annual CO2 emissions. - The project will contribute an estimated US$7 million per annum of tax revenues to the exchequer.

OCL India Limited (OCL or the Company) is an existing IFC client and a leading cement producer in eastern India with a capacity of 3.8 million tons per annum (MTPA). The Company started manufacturing cement in 1952. OCL also manufactures refractories. OCL proposes to setup a 1.35 million tons per annum (MTPA) greenfield cement grinding unit at Medinipur, West Bengal (the Project).

name.narrative: The Project will be located at village Kulapachuria, Salboni sub-division, District Medinipur, West Bengal. The proposed site is located at approximately 1 km distance from National Highway 60 and 20 km from National Highway 6. As a part of developing Godapaisal Industrial Park the West Bengal Industrial Development Corporation has acquired and leased 154.43 acres of land for the Project to OCL as the anchor investor.
